name: Power the Coast
description:
Introduction

Power Turbine maintenance can be a challenging job. If they're too slow they won't produce power, if they're too fast they might explode! Are you up to the task to keep a continuous flow of power to the coast?

Inspiration Rampion Offshore Wind Farm [Online].

The inspiration for this project was the 'Rampion Offshore Wind Farm' which is located off the coast of Worthing and Brighton. I grew up in Worthing and was there for the construction of the wind farm so I feel it's a topic close to home.

Click here if you'd like to read more about the Rampion Offshore Wind Farm.

Sources

Prior to the project I did my best to research key facts about the Wind Turbines so that it was somewhat realistic. This means power generated by each turbine is actually correct at 3.45MW!

Power Generated by a Rampion Offshore Wind Farm Turbine.

Power consumption of common electronics.

Fun Wind Power Facts.
